title: About Me
text:
Hi there!
Here are a few photos I’ve taken from various trips that I think are super cool. The first photo was taken in Puerto Viejo, Costa Rica on a hiking trip, the second paddle boarding in Santa Barbara, the third & fourth rock climbing and whale watching in Alaska.
A bit more about me:
I am a soon to be graduate of the University of California Santa Barbara, with a B.S. in Environmental Studies (as well as a minor in French). During my studies I have focused on course work related to ecology, restoration, and botany. I have a passion for plants as well as conservation, and I have completed various internships related to plant restoration as well as plant phenology.
My two most recent internships have been with the UCSB Cheadle Center. There I have completed an internship in restoration at the campus lagoon where I gained experience in transect monitoring, restoration techniques, and greenhouse work. My most recent internship has been collecting and analyzing phenology data related to plants at the lagoon. To explore more about this please see the projects tab.
Going forward, I hope to find a job in conservation biology, restoration ecology, or a related field. After that I hope to go to graduate school for botany or plant ecology.
In my free time, I love to get outside! I enjoy surfing, hiking, swimming, kayaking, backpacking, and biking. Check out the tab on surfing and hiking if you want to learn more.

title: Nathan Seaway
text:
Hello! Welcome to my personal website. My name is Nathan Seaway, and I am a fourth year student at UCSB, majoring in Environmental Studies with a minor in French. My course work and work experience mostly focus on ecology, restoration, and botany. This website showcases some of my hobbies, projects, and work experiences. Thank you for visiting!
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites, visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Restoration Management Plan Group Project
text:
This mock restoration management plan was part of a group project I worked on for a class called Foundation of Ecosystem Restoration. It is a detailed hypothetical plan for the restoration of the grassland of More Mesa in Santa Barbara, Ca.
 View Full Restoration Management Plan (PDF)
